sourceDesc.p: created retrospectively from svn ChangeLog and SourceForge trackers

body.p:
Some of the more noticeable changes in this release include:
The front page of the online Guidelines has been revised
docDate is now available as a child of dateLine (https://sourceforge.net/p/tei/feature-requests/472/), and the content models of signed and salute been loosened (; ) to allow more flexibility in the top tail of sections (prompted by experience in EEBO TCP)
poetry (l) is now allowed in the trailer
Usage of corresp has been clarified (https://sourceforge.net/p/tei/bugs/506/).
The value of the matchPattern attribute is now defined as W3C XPath syntax rather than W3C XML Schema Language (https://sourceforge.net/p/tei/feature-requests/432/). This allows for more powerful regular expressions.
perf on tech now has the datatype 1+ data.pointer, instead of data.enumerated (http://sourceforge.net/p/tei/bugs/524/).
support for pure ODD: it is now possible to define co tent models using TEI XML constructs only, as an alternative to the use of RELAXNG. This change is discussed further in a paper by Burnard and Rahtz presented at this year's ACM Document Engineering conference.
use of the element valDesc throughout the TEI specifications code was rationalised: mostly this involved removal of redundant commentary, but in some cases element or attribute descriptions have been extended or modified.
a new abstract element has been added to support descriptive metadata about a "born-digital" item (such as a journal article in a review) to be stored in the TEI Header per

There are also some changes to the way the Council is managing the Guidelines:
Pre-release versions of the TEI P5 development tree are now tagged as "alpha" and "beta" in their version information.
Preparatory to a program of getting translations of reference documentation up to date, all desc and gloss elements have been dated. This allows us to easily generate lists of translated blocks which are need revising.
The XSL stylesheets which provide processing of TEI ODD files for Roma and OxGarage have been updated, notably providing better support for multi-namespace ODD
